findings.title: Unused Internal Function Found
findings.description: Internal functions are declared but not used within the contract.

findings.title: Concise Code with Insufficient Checks
findings.description: The code is written concisely but lacks informative and secure practices by not utilizing sufficient checks and modifiers.

findings.title: The use of variables and naming conventions can be minimized
findings.description: Code is written in a very concise way which can lead to security issues if not properly checked and modified.

findings.title: Proper Gas Use and Optimization
findings.description: Gas use is proper and optimized as per the testing on the Ropsten test network and checking of the old transaction from this contract.

findings.title: Lack of Locking Function for Security Issues
findings.description: The contract lacks a locking mechanism to prevent security issues or losses, which can be mitigated by allowing the admin to lock the contract in case of an emergency.

findings.title: Improper Use of Burn and Mint Functions
findings.description: The burn and mint functions are not properly used or utilized according to their logic, resulting in a fixed supply to the contract.

findings.title: Owner Functions Missing
findings.description: The smart contract lacks essential owner functions such as change owner, get owner, and check owner, which are highly recommended.
